comment: Larrotta is a great Spanish instructor. I have always struggled with foreign languages but he made the material very easy to learn. Show up and do your assignments and you will get an A. The actual class is very fun and engaging. Larotta is pretty hilarious himself. I would highly recommend taking him.

Aside from elementary school, this is the only Spanish class I have ever taken. It was straight forward and to the point. He gives a lot of easy 100 assignments. Honestly, show up, listen, pass. He makes it so there's no way you won't do well unless you never come to class. Take him and you will be fine! I took the hybrid:online test/final.

Larotta has this down. Lectures cover basic Spanish. Lots of class interaction, but it's fun.  Every time I looked at the grade distribution for a quiz everyone either got 100 or a 0. So just try, show up every class and you'll get an A. Tests count for 30%, final exam 20%, online packets 15%, group project 15%, participation 10%, and quizzes 10%.

Wonderful Professor who goes step by step in helping you learn sentence structure and books. Interactive Activites are given in class and it really helps you grasp the language! I was terrible at Spanish and Professor Larrotta changed that for me! He's awesome and really enjoys teaching!

Excellent professor!! learn a lot even in a hybrid class. Definitely take! packets, exams, and project are really easy! i would definitely take him again. make sure to come to class because its difficult to learn a language using only a book.
Extremely helpful prof. He cares about his students, and he really wants his students to learn, and he makes classes fun and interesting. The best Spanish teacher I had at KSU.

As a Spanish major Professor Larotta was the best teacher i have ever had for 2001 and 2002 Spanish. I am taking an upper level practical conversation class and all the tools and tips he gives you you will absolutely need. Please pay attention and use the advice he gives. He is preparing you to be successful.

Best professor I've had yet in college. You can tell he's really passionate about what he's teaching, and he really wants you to learn the language. All of the activities he does in class are designed to help you learn and have fun. He's hilarious! I really looked forward to and enjoyed coming to class every day and for an 8am that says a lot.

I had Professor Larrotta in High School and he was, and still is, an amazing teacher. He wants every student to not only pass, but excell in spanish. He has many great teaching ideas and makes spanish seem approachable. overall an amazing professor.

I have taken Larrotta for all my Spanish classes because he is great! Very helpful, wants all students to pass and an all around great person and professor. He assigns extra credit assignments to help your grade, test corrections (occasionally)and really makes an impact on your level of comprehension by talking in Spanish ALOT. TAKE HIM!

Professor Rodney es muy simpatico y inteligente. He makes spanish interesting and uses the textbook, youtube, guest speaker, dancing, singing to help us feel and love the culture. You have to throw yourself in the culture and it is fun! Tests are from book and class. Fun mini assignments like visit a spanish store. Group assignmnt on ppt.

This class was hard. No lie! But because Prof Larrotta made it interesting, and showed so much passion, he made me want to put effort into learning as well. There is alot of speaking and conversation but he gives you time to prepare and discussions all of which are in spanish. It was a fun class

Larrotta is awesome! He makes learning and wanting to learn spanish easy. He makes the grammar part of the language really easy and breaks it down so its easier to digest and remember. Just study the vocab and do the homeworks and you'll def get an A. Best spanish teacher i've had, for sure!

Mr. Larrotta is a great teacher!  He really wants everyone to learn and is very encouraging.  He makes the class fun and is willing to work with you to help you succeed.  I hope to have him in future advance spanish classes.

Rodney is very passoniate about teaching Spanish. He really wants you to do well. MUST come to class. Class is intense and requires a lot of work. Rodney will bend over backwards to work with you and gives lots of extra-credit. Would highly recommend. Tests aren't bad as long as you have kept up with class work.
